extracted_objects.name: Continuity Constants Table
extracted_objects.description: Comprehensive table of 44+ constants organized by type

extracted_objects.name: Empirical Aggregator Lipschitz Constants
extracted_objects.description: Collection of 5 Lipschitz constants for empirical moments

extracted_objects.name: Total Value Error Coefficient for Standardization
extracted_objects.description: Three-component coefficient (direct, mean, std) for standardization

extracted_objects.name: Distance Measurement Mean-Square Constants
extracted_objects.description: Three constants (positional, linear status, quadratic status)

extracted_objects.name: Cloning Probability Lipschitz Constants
extracted_objects.description: Four constants for cloning probability continuity

extracted_objects.name: Fitness Potential Bounds
extracted_objects.description: Lower and upper bounds on fitness potential

extracted_objects.name: Perturbation Stage Constants
extracted_objects.description: Three constants for Gaussian perturbation bounds

extracted_objects.name: Boundary Regularity Constants
extracted_objects.description: Two constants (Hölder constant, Hölder exponent) for death probability

extracted_objects.name: Rescale Function Lipschitz Constants
extracted_objects.description: Three constants for rescale function and composition

extracted_objects.name: One-Step Mean-Square Continuity Coefficients
extracted_objects.description: Complete collection of final coefficients (Lipschitz, Hölder, offset)

extracted_objects.name: Standardization Standard Deviation Lower Bound
extracted_objects.description: Uniform lower bound on smoothed standard deviation

sensitivity_reduction: Increase epsilon_std or kappa_var_min to decrease C_V_total
Larger k (alive walkers) tightens empirical-moment Lipschitz factors
Smaller sigma (tighter perturbation) reduces post-perturbation constants
Conservative p_max and larger eta shrink L_pi constants
key_scaling_laws: C_V_total scales as O(epsilon_std^{-6}) when kappa_var_min << epsilon_std^2
L_death scales inversely with sigma: L_death ~ Per(E)/sigma
Perturbation bounds scale as O(N*d*sigma^2) deterministically
